title: Brave New World: My ID, Your ID
body:
To the Editor:

 Your May 20 front-page article about foreigners who are obtaining Social Security numbers illegally identified one 
foreigner who had used the Social Security number of a New Jersey woman who died in 1991. In this regard it is 
worth noting that the Social Security Death Index, a database that is available free at several genealogy sites on the 
Web, makes it possible for anyone to search for and identify dead people and their Social Security numbers.

JOHN CATANZARITI

Syosset, N.Y., May 23, 2002

http://www.nytimes.com
